summary: may I request a marvel and hp ship? i'm a bisexual female, hufflepuff. i have long(like butt long) dark hair, green-blue eyes,...
question: may I request a marvel and hp ship? i'm a bisexual female, hufflepuff. i have long(like butt long) dark hair, green-blue eyes, and am pretty curvy. I'm quite nice, I think, I really like helping other people and I'm helpful. I also doubt myself too much. I love animals, food, and nature. hate quidditch. thx
answer:
Hello dear! I ship you with…

peter parker!

-so first of all, I think you and peter would be so adorbs

-sorry for that haha

-anyways, you and peter got on wonderfully

-i’d see you as a year or two younger than him. when he was a junior, you were a freshman, and the way you met was such a cliche move

-so it was your first day of school and you were trying to find your locker

-and when peter saw this beautiful girl with long dark hair wandering around aimlessly, he automatically came to her rescue

-not sorry for that lol

-so he came and helped you, and you introduced yourself, and eventually you became pretty close friends. the introduction went something along the lines of this.

- “um, hi. do you know where the west wing is?”

- “uh, to the west. i mean, over there.” *points*

- “oh…thanks. i’m [y/n], sorry, it’s my first year and i have no clue where anything is. thanks for helping me.”

- “i’m peter, peter parker. and no problem.”

-so again, you two eventually became close friends and ran into each other randomly

-and one day, he told aunt may about you

-and omg did she flip

-she was so excited for peter and after he told her about you she was literally in love with you before even meeting you. this kind, hippie sort of girl with a love of animals? well duh

-so then he invited you over 

-FINALLY

-and you bonded with peter and aunt may that night

-so when peter asked you out on a date and you were all flustered but still said yes, may was so supportive of you two and would do everything in her willpower to make your relationship last

-i feel like your relationship would be based around cute, happy things

-like tickle wars, and eating sandwiches from delmar’s deli in the park, or reading books to one another, or building a fort and cuddling

-and oMG this boy can cuddle

-so yeah

-your relationship is just perfect

-everyone loves you

-even tony ‘protective father’ stark

-and steve ‘be back by seven’ rogers

-and natasha says if peter does anything to hurt you she’ll personally shoot him

-did i mention you met the avengers? yeah they all loved you

-this was too long sry XD

and…

cedric diggory!

-aww your relationship with ceddy would be perfect too

-so you’re in the same year as him and he’s always sort of fancied you

-i mean what’s not to love darling? you’re beautiful, and kindhearted, and it felt like he always heard birds singing when he saw you

-ok maybe that was his imagination, but still

-ever since second year when his friends had started sitting with two of your closest friends, maggie and ivy, he had started to talk to you more

-his two closest friends were kind of sort of ‘dating’ your two closest friends by fifth year, so the two of you were left awkwardly talking

-tbh though, you had liked him since second year too

-and when the boi finally worked up the nerve to ask you on a hogsmeade date, you oBviOuSly accepted and from that moment on #[y/s/n] sailed happily ever after

-sort of

-ok, just have to say this. he loves your curves

-even though you can be self conscious at times cedric’s always there to nurture you and tell you you’re beautiful. cuz you are :)

-oh right

-one of your pet peeves that he loved doing was qUIDDITCH

-you hated quidditch and you hated that he played quidditch despite that you still went to every single one of his games and cheered for hufflepuff(but mostly cedric) at every. single. one. of. them. 

-you were afraid he’d get hurt, cuz fun fact, the reason you hated quidditch was because you had once played quidditch for the huffies and been an amazing chaser

-but then you fell off your broom 200 feet up

-and you’ve hated it ever since

-but yeah

-anyways, your relationship would be pretty stable and you weren’t entirely jealous of the many many mANY girls who thought he was handsome

-cuz he was he is

-but i think it would also be built on silly, romantic things, that were actually really sweet and both of you loved

-like wearing his jacket whenever you were cold, or picnic dates near the black lake, or falling asleep while cuddling in the hufflepuff common room, and lazy thumb wars, or those times when you’d sneak up to the astronomy tower at night and look at the stars

-then fall asleep

-and get detention from filch the next day but still know it was worth it

-yeah

- #[y/s/n] for lifeeeee

(by [y/s/n] i mean your ship name, and by [y/n] i mean your name) this was really fun, thanks for the request love!

title: Lead Me Through The Dark
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2GnckYW

by Baccatapages

His new Mistress, Mistress ‘call me y/n’ L/n was beautiful. She had a natural beauty and gentle kindness that was rare amongst people nowadays. Steve had never seen a woman dressed in armour before and had to admit that if he weren’t a slave, he wouldn’t dare challenge her. For all her aura, it was clear she ran things with an iron fist.

summary: peter isn’t the only one who finds refuge in a queens library

warning: none :)

A/N: hello!! @nerdybreadcollaborative and i had a library prompt and we wrote the first thing that came into our heads. hugo read her writing please, it’s amazing. i’ll link it here :)

libraries were the perfect place to read, sleep, fall in love… it was like time stopped around you for the few hours you spent in them. and that’s what peter loved most about the quaint library that was a block from his small, shared apartment. he could be curled up in the corner with a good book without any consequences for his actions.

peter loved to observe people. he’d stare at someone who peaked her interest and assign them a greatly-detailed backstory of who they were.

but when he walked into the library in the early afternoon, it was deserted. only him and the librarian in the dimly lit room. and the librarian was obviously surprised as he waddled in, the door making a loud creaking sound as it opened. the young boy violently shivered as he entered the warm building. head relieved to finally be out of the cold. there was supposed to be a brutal snow storm attacking new york later on tonight, but peter -like always- just wanted to be in the library.

and apparently so did someone else. a shy girl who was curled up at the corner of the library, nose dug deep into her book. and from her position with her knees bent up to hide herself and the way she glanced up at peter and back to her book rather quickly, he could tell that she wasn’t very fond of being the center of attention.

but unfortunately for her, she was quietly reading in the boy’s favorite section of the library, murder mysteries and thrillers. he always managed to solve the resolution before the author had the chance to tell the readers. peter was very observant.

“shouldn’t you be home? there’s a snow storm coming”, he informs the shy girl. her cheeks heat up immediately and she puts her book cover in between her page to save her place.

“i could ask you the same thing”. her voice came out just above a whisper and there was a hint of a smile on her lips. her doe-like eyes quickly looked over peter’s appearance; slightly frizzy and curly hair, dark clothes and a thick book tucked under his arm. she found him intriguing, a word she didn’t use for most people.

peter smiles back, realizing he recognizes the mousy girl. he’s kept an eye on her for a few weeks, noticing how she barely spoke unless spoken to and how she always left before the sun was completely down. he had taken a liking in her, not too sure when it started, but his feelings were definitely there.

with new-found courage, peter plants herself a few feet away from her, mirroring how the shy girl is sitting as their backs are against the hard library wall. she lets out a relieved sigh, appreciating how peter didn’t push her into conversation, and digs her nose back into her book, as if he had never introduced herself. she wasn’t doing it to be rude, she just had a reputation of being a bookworm.

after what felt like hours of silence, the quiet pair jumped from their place on the floor as they heard the hard metal library door slams shut. it made the books on the shelves rattle and a few shook just enough to topple onto the floor.

“what was that?”. the mousy girl’s voice was shaky, not sure what had happened.

peter slowly crawls across the carpeted floor and peeks just enough to see an empty chair where the librarian usually sits and some snow melting away near the entrance.

“we’re alone”, he deadpans. y/n’s eyes widen and she briskly walks over to where peter is now standing.

“alone? w-what do you mean?”. she was frightened, she really needed to head home before her parents worried, and unfortunately for her there was no service in the library. it was done on purpose, to make sure that kids were actually doing their homework rather than engaging on their devices.

“i guess she forgot we were in here”. although it was terrible news to hear, peter couldn’t help but smile. there was something… nice about being alone in the huge queens library.

“well… what do we do now?”. both of them could see the heavy now flakes piling up the windows, making it even harder to see outside. and she was just about to suggest sucking it up and struggle to walk back home but the roar of heavy winds shut her up.

“i guess we just… wait it out?”. something about the situation seemed like it could’ve been in a romantic-comedy… 2 strangers meet in a library, trapped together because of a heavy storm. something about it felt almost clichè. but peter didn’t question it. maybe it was…luck? fate?

with nothing else better to do, the two make conversation, peter asking what the quiet girl’s name was and successfully making her come out of her shell, her feeling comfortable enough to talk above a whisper. they didn’t need to whisper anyway, there was no one else there.

the next time either of them checked their phones was just before 8 pm. it was far later than they thought and they both hurried to put their jackets and hats on. they both hoped the blizzard wasn’t as bad as before.

unfortunately for them, the library door was frozen shut, the severe weather outside freezing the old metal door, locking them inside for the night.

they were snowed in.

it wasn’t as bad as it sounded, there was a vending machine that -in the worst case scenario- they could break into for some snacks, and the heat had been blasting all afternoon, so the pair didn’t need to worry about finding a place to keep warm.

a small smile appears on both of their faces, knowing that they had hours until the weather was manageable to walk home in.

“i guess we’re stuck here”, y/n says as she tries not to look so happy. she was enjoying the last few hours with peter and was almost disappointed when they both thought it was time to leave.

“yeah, i guess we are”. peter looked just as pleased, pleasantly surprised that y/n was taking the news so well.

the pair talked and joked and read with each other until the early morning, hidden away in their small corner of the library. they laughed until the sun came up, the inevitable exhaustion finally allowing both of them to fall asleep curled into each other. their soft breaths were the only sounds filling the empty library and the only proof that they had been stuck their all night was their resting bodies and the memories they had shared.

summary: “Okay, maybe I am a bit jealous.” or something along those lines w peter? i love your writing !
question: “Okay, maybe I am a bit jealous.” or something along those lines w peter? i love your writing !
answer:
send me prompts ~ peter parker x reader

“You think I like Liz?” Peter scrunched up his nose, the confused expression making you laugh a little. “Why?”

“Come on, dude,” you scoffed, pointing at her across the cafeteria, where she was hanging up a sign. “I’d tap that, too. You can just admit it already.”

“But-but I don’t,” he put his hands up, still looking confused, “I don’t get why you’d think I do?”

“I mean, come on,” you shrugged, “You’re always talking to Ned about this perfect person, someone you want to ask out but you’re too scared to - I know it’s Liz! Everyone likes Liz. I figured you did too.”

You said the last part a little sourly, and it didn’t go unnoticed by Peter. He realized the whole time he was talking to Ned about the person he liked, you must have heard it - but you must not have realized who he was talking about, because it definitely wasn’t Liz.

“That sounded a little jealous,” he pointed out, grinning when he saw you look away and make a face.

“Okay, maybe I am a little bit jealous,” you muttered, frowning a little. But his laugh made you look back at him, cringing a little in case he was laughing at you.

Instead, he took your hand in his, giving you a wide smile.

“Good, because the person I’ve been talking about is you.”

title: little italy
body:
pairing: peter parker x reader

wc: 2,353

summary: it’s the weekend and peter wants to do nothing but spend time with y/n, but flash seems to have other plans.

warnings: confrontation

author’s corner: hi everyone, perhaps a bit too short? idk, but I really like where things go at the end :’) also, go and read chapter three, which was written by my beautiful friend @underoos-shield! she’s ah-mazinggggg

three / four / –> / masterlist

After a couple of days of touring Italy and doing part one of a weekly scavenger hunt during one of the class trips, it was finally the weekend. This meant that on Saturday, everyone slept in until the sun was high up in the sky, shining down on their faces through the sheer curtains of their hotel rooms.

Ned was the first one to wake up from the two boys, and proceeded to sing loudly as he showered and got ready for the day. Peter groaned, flipping over towards the wall as he pulled the covers over his head. Steam billows out of the restroom when Ned opens the door. He lowers his singing down to humming as he does his hair and slips on his shoes.

“Are you not going to come down for breakfast? MJ and Betty are already in the courtyard waiting for us dude.” Ned asks. He grabs one of the keycards from the table and glances at Peter, who has now removed the blanket from over his head and is looking at him.

“I just need a second. You can go on down though.” Ned nods and exits the room, leaving Peter alone to get ready.

The  day was beginning to feel rather warm, which helped Peter in leaning towards wearing some shorts and a light flannel over one of his graphic shirts he’d packed. After brushing his teeth and doing his hair, he grabs his copy of the keycard and heads down to the courtyard to join his friends.

Y/N is standing at the far end gate near the kitchen, watching everyone. She wears a white sundress with tiny red printed roses, and it flutters in the wind. Her hands are cross in front of her, a look of boredom on her face. Peter glances between his friends and y/n, hesitating on who to approach first but goes for the first option. He didn’t quite want his little secret that was with y/n to be shown quite yet.

“Hey Peter.” Betty smiles up happily at her boyfriend’s friend, who is settling into his seat. He smiles and looks down at his menu for the breakfast options.

“Hey Betty, hi MJ. How are you guys?” he asks.

The group chats, the conversation growing into what they were planning to do with their day. Y/N was about to head to their table to take Peter’s order when someone grabs her hand. She looks down to see who it is and finds a smiling Flash. Her own smile falters a bit until she recomposes herself and gently pulls away from him.

“Ciao, bellezza/Hello beautiful.” Flash pulls the chair next to him for her to sit down while his friends watch the interaction curiously. They’d known about Flash wanting to get with y/n, but weren’t sure how he even planned to do that. She seemed to be more interested in Peter, after all.

“Ciao, Flash. Ti serve qualcosa?/Hello Flash. Do you need anything” y/n asks. “Forse un po ‘di acqua in più?/Maybe a little extra water?”

“No grazie. In realtà mi stavo chiedendo se ti piacerebbe unirti a me per un pomeriggio insieme. Solo noi/No thanks. Actually I was wondering if you’d like to join me for an afternoon together. Only us.”

Y/N opens her mouth, but hesitates to answer at all. Her gaze wanders to Peter’s table, where she could see that he was watching her curiously. She sighs. She did not want to be rude, but she also did not want to spend time with someone who was rude and bullied others. She wanted to spend time with a kind boy who read to her, told her nice stories, someone with curly brown hair and kind eyes.

“I do not think it would be okay, Flash.” y/n says in her rough english. Flash’s smile tightens.

“Why not?”

“Non ho bisogno di una ragione/I do not need a reason”

“Solo un pomeriggio/Only one afternoon.”

Y/N stands from the seat and takes her small notepad with her. Flash watches as she struts away, not even glancing back at him.

“I’ll get her later.” he mutters to himself.

Peter, having watched the whole interaction is concerned when y/n approaches the table. Her once happy demeanor was gone, and she seemed drained. What had Flash told her?

“Sei pronto per ordinare, Peter/Are you ready to order, Peter?” she asks in a soft voice. The group doesn’t notice anything as Peter orders, and continue to eat and chat among themselves.

When Peter is done ordering, he asks, “Are you alright?”

All Peter gets is a simple,“Sì/Yes,” before y/n tucks her pencil behind her ear and gets going into the kitchen. It was all he got to see of y/n after breakfast. During the short time the gang was at the hotel, she would go out of her way to not bump into Peter. Flash, when asked about what he’d said to her, shrugged and smiled.

“Maybe she realized what a loser you are, Parker.”

He couldn’t focus on the picnic his friends planned. His mind kept wandering back to y/n, thinking about what was wrong. What idea had Flash planted in her head? Why had he seen her alone with him, leaving the hotel before his friends had left for the park? Had he done something wrong?

“Peter, hello?” MJ punches his arm, to which Peter protests. “I said what are you thinking about? Is it aunt May?”

“I…” Peter sighs and nods. “I’m worried about how she’s doing alone. How Queens is doing.”

It was not a lie. He knew aunt May would slap his wrists if she knew he was worrying about her. She wanted him to enjoy his vacation, to take in all the sites and not think about home. He was worried about crime in Queens, in New York really, although that was already taken care of anyways. His Avengers friends were always there, and Spider-Man being gone wouldn’t make things too bad. Even then, his aunt had packed his suit “just in case” he needed it in Italy, which he hadn’t.

Ned pats his friends arm understandingly. “Everything back home is fine. Aunt May wouldn’t want you thinking about her right now.”

“It’s okay to be homesick, Peter. Especially if you’ve never been so far away from everything. But you’ve got us, and we are going to make sure you have fun.” Betty smiles at him. “Come on, let’s play with the frisbee I packed.”

After she materializes a pink plastic disk from her backpack everyone spreads out on the field. The warm day was perfect for a game of frisbee, especially because the wind had died down and wouldn’t be interfering with the way it flew. A couple classmates who’d also decided to go to the park that afternoon joined the game. A few locals who had just been taking a dip in the lake joined them as well, calling for an even bigger space to throw the plastic circle around.

Once the sun began to set and the sky changed from blue to oranges and reds and pinks, everyone began dispersing and going home. Peter packed up the picnic basket and handed it to Betty, and Ned took her backpack. MJ folded up the blanket, and with that the group was ready to head back to the hotel.

“I’m going to get us a good table for dinner, I’ll see you guys in a bit.” Peter says. His friends, thinking nothing of it, head up to their rooms to drop off their things while Peter heads towards the courtyard, where he guessed y/n may be. He was right, but she wasn’t alone.

Flash sat next to her on the bench that y/n and Peter typically sat at to read, and his arm was snaking its way around her shoulders. Peter watches as she goes to shrug him off, only for Flash to pull her closer. He leans into her ear and whispers something, which seems to be the last straw as y/n gets up and pushes his off of her.

“What are you doing to y/n?” Peter asks, making his way towards the two. Y/N, surprised, glances at Peter and gives him a thankful look. Flash looks irritated and sighs, standing up.

“What is it to you, Parker? Y/N and I were just getting to know each other.”

“Looks to me that you were about to leave.”

Flash is taken by surprise by Peter’s words directed at him. He did not expect Peter to show up, much less for him to talk to him that way. Flash scoffs and glares at the two of them. Y/N is now standing behind Peter, holding on to his arm. Their classmates were beginning to arrive down for dinner, so Flash gives up for the time being.

“This isn’t over, Parker.”

Y/N and Peter watch as Flash heads inside to the eating area, and Peter can feel as y/n relaxes once he’s gone. He turns to her and cups her face, studying her to make sure that she is okay.

“Stai bene/Are you okay?”

Y/N nods, smiling up softly at the American boy. “lo sono ora/I am now. Thank you.”

“Of course.”

“Perhaps you should go and meet your friends before they wonder what is going on. I will see you after?” she asks hopefully. Peter nods, and on a whim, leans down to kiss her forehead. He freezes like that once he realizes what he’s done, and y/n giggles. She cups his face and pecks his cheeks. “Go.”

Peter goes to one of the empty tables and sits to wait for his friends. His face was still bright red, but thankfully, with the sun setting, it was not that noticeable.

“Sorry for taking so long, Betty and MJ showered and are taking forever to get ready so I just came down.” Ned sighs, plopping down on one of the chairs next to Peter. Peter looks up at his friend and nods. “Did I miss anything?”

“I mean, Flash harassing y/n, the girl who works here? Other then that, I guess not.”

“She’s the daughter of the owners of the hotel, right?”

“Yeah,” Peter nods. “The pretty one.”

Although Peter says this in a rather hushes tone, Ned hears it and grins. “Do you like her?”

“What?” Peter is flustered and unsure of what to say. Ned shakes his head and sighs.

“It’s okay, Peter. It’s been forever since Liz, so I think it was only a matter of time before you liked someone else.”

Before Peter could say anything else, Betty and MJ join the boys and the group begins browsing the menu, which offered different things everyday. It helped keep a variation on the foods that the hotel guests could eat, which was great. When y/n makes her way over to take their order, Ned eyes Peter teasingly, which only makes him blush even more. Y/N doesn’t really understand what is going on but doesn’t ask. Instead, she picks up their menus and tells them that someone will bring up their drinks and food in a minute.

As planned, Peter waits for y/n after everyone is done with dinner. Most of his classmates had gone down to the game room to play pool and whatnot, while others were either in their room or in the courtyard. Y/N comes out of the kitchen , but today she is not holding her copy of Call Me By Your Name.

“Scusate per il ritardo/Sorry for the delay.”

“Non ti preoccupare, non mi dispiace/Do not worry, I don’t mind.”

Y/N smiles at him, the corners of her eyes wrinkling. She offers her hand, which Peter takes shyly.

“We can go on a walk today? A break from reading.” y/n suggests.

Peter agrees, and the two exit the hotel and walk down the worn sidewalk. The sun has long since gone down, and in its place was a pale, full moon. Crickets chirped from somewhere nearby, and the leaves rustled gently, dancing with the wind. Peter wasn’t necessarily sure where y/n was taking him, but he didn’t mind. As long as he was with her, he felt at ease, and he hoped she felt the same way. They end up at the park that Peter had been at earlier that day, and the two walk towards the sandy shore of the lake. Warm water rippled from the center of the lake towards the edge, causing the tiniest waves. The moon’s reflection lit up the area, lit up y/n’s face even, as he turned to look at her.

She wore a thoughtful look on her face. Her loose hair tumbled down her shoulders, and Peter gave into his urge of tucking some behind her ear. Y/N smiled as she turned to look at him.

“Flash ti ha ferito/Did Flash hurt you?” Peter asks quietly.

“No. Ma parliamo di qualcos'altro/No, but let’s talk about something else, please?”

“Okay.”

The couple sits down close to each other and look out at the water, silent for a moment before y/n talks. She asks about Peter’s life in New York, what the states are like and his family and friends. As the two talk, y/n rests her head on his shoulders, curling up closer to the boy. After a moment of hesitation, Peter puts an arm around her, which she holds with her own.

It had not been the best day, not for y/n, but being here with a boy like Peter, near calming waters talking about each other, she hoped it would mean it would all be okay. At least for tonight. She was glad Peter didn’t push her to talk about things she didn’t want to. That he cared about her feelings, and above all, he respected her. Peter was what she wanted in a boy.

She looks down to see who it is and finds a smiling Flash. Her own smile falters a bit until she recomposes herself and gently pulls away from him.

“Ciao, bellezza/Hello beautiful.” Flash pulls the chair next to him for her to sit down while his friends watch the interaction curiously. They’d known about Flash wanting to get with y/n, but weren’t sure how he even planned to do that. She seemed to be more interested in Peter, after all.

“Ciao, Flash. Ti serve qualcosa?/Hello Flash. Do you need anything” y/n asks. “Forse un po ‘di acqua in più?/Maybe a little extra water?”

“No grazie. In realtà mi stavo chiedendo se ti piacerebbe unirti a me per un pomeriggio insieme. Solo noi/No thanks. Actually I was wondering if you’d like to join me for an afternoon together. Only us.”

Y/N opens her mouth, but hesitates to answer at all. Her gaze wanders to Peter’s table, where she could see that he was watching her curiously. She sighs. She did not want to be rude, but she also did not want to spend time with someone who was rude and bullied others. She wanted to spend time with a kind boy who read to her, told her nice stories, someone with curly brown hair and kind eyes.

“I do not think it would be okay, Flash.” y/n says in her rough english. Flash’s smile tightens.

“Why not?”

“Non ho bisogno di una ragione/I do not need a reason”

“Solo un pomeriggio/Only one afternoon.”

Y/N stands from the seat and takes her small notepad with her. Flash watches as she struts away, not even glancing back at him.

“I’ll get her later.” he mutters to himself.

Peter, having watched the whole interaction is concerned when y/n approaches the table. Her once happy demeanor was gone, and she seemed drained. What had Flash told her?

“Sei pronto per ordinare, Peter/Are you ready to order, Peter?” she asks in a soft voice. The group doesn’t notice anything as Peter orders, and continue to eat and chat among themselves.

When Peter is done ordering, he asks, “Are you alright?”

All Peter gets is a simple,“Sì/Yes,” before y/n tucks her pencil behind her ear and gets going into the kitchen. It was all he got to see of y/n after breakfast. During the short time the gang was at the hotel, she would go out of her way to not bump into Peter. Flash, when asked about what he’d said to her, shrugged and smiled.

“Maybe she realized what a loser you are, Parker.”

He couldn’t focus on the picnic his friends planned. His mind kept wandering back to y/n, thinking about what was wrong. What idea had Flash planted in her head? Why had he seen her alone with him, leaving the hotel before his friends had left for the park? Had he done something wrong?

“Peter, hello?” MJ punches his arm, to which Peter protests. “I said what are you thinking about? Is it aunt May?”

“I…” Peter sighs and nods. “I’m worried about how she’s doing alone. How Queens is doing.”

It was not a lie. He knew aunt May would slap his wrists if she knew he was worrying about her. She wanted him to enjoy his vacation, to take in all the sites and not think about home. He was worried about crime in Queens, in New York really, although that was already taken care of anyways. His Avengers friends were always there, and Spider-Man being gone wouldn’t make things too bad. Even then, his aunt had packed his suit “just in case” he needed it in Italy, which he hadn’t.

Ned pats his friends arm understandingly. “Everything back home is fine. Aunt May wouldn’t want you thinking about her right now.”

“It’s okay to be homesick, Peter. Especially if you’ve never been so far away from everything. But you’ve got us, and we are going to make sure you have fun.” Betty smiles at him. “Come on, let’s play with the frisbee I packed.”

After she materializes a pink plastic disk from her backpack everyone spreads out on the field. The warm day was perfect for a game of frisbee, especially because the wind had died down and wouldn’t be interfering with the way it flew. A couple classmates who’d also decided to go to the park that afternoon joined the game. A few locals who had just been taking a dip in the lake joined them as well, calling for an even bigger space to throw the plastic circle around.

Once the sun began to set and the sky changed from blue to oranges and reds and pinks, everyone began dispersing and going home. Peter packed up the picnic basket and handed it to Betty, and Ned took her backpack. MJ folded up the blanket, and with that the group was ready to head back to the hotel.

“I’m going to get us a good table for dinner, I’ll see you guys in a bit.” Peter says. His friends, thinking nothing of it, head up to their rooms to drop off their things while Peter heads towards the courtyard, where he guessed y/n may be. He was right, but she wasn’t alone.

Flash sat next to her on the bench that y/n and Peter typically sat at to read, and his arm was snaking its way around her shoulders. Peter watches as she goes to shrug him off, only for Flash to pull her closer. He leans into her ear and whispers something, which seems to be the last straw as y/n gets up and pushes his off of her.

“What are you doing to y/n?” Peter asks, making his way towards the two. Y/N, surprised, glances at Peter and gives him a thankful look. Flash looks irritated and sighs, standing up.

“What is it to you, Parker? Y/N and I were just getting to know each other.”

“Looks to me that you were about to leave.”

Flash is taken by surprise by Peter’s words directed at him. He did not expect Peter to show up, much less for him to talk to him that way. Flash scoffs and glares at the two of them. Y/N is now standing behind Peter, holding on to his arm. Their classmates were beginning to arrive down for dinner, so Flash gives up for the time being.

“This isn’t over, Parker.”

Y/N and Peter watch as Flash heads inside to the eating area, and Peter can feel as y/n relaxes once he’s gone. He turns to her and cups her face, studying her to make sure that she is okay.

“Stai bene/Are you okay?”

Y/N nods, smiling up softly at the American boy. “lo sono ora/I am now. Thank you.”

“Of course.”

“Perhaps you should go and meet your friends before they wonder what is going on. I will see you after?” she asks hopefully. Peter nods, and on a whim, leans down to kiss her forehead. He freezes like that once he realizes what he’s done, and y/n giggles. She cups his face and pecks his cheeks. “Go.”

Peter goes to one of the empty tables and sits to wait for his friends. His face was still bright red, but thankfully, with the sun setting, it was not that noticeable.

“Sorry for taking so long, Betty and MJ showered and are taking forever to get ready so I just came down.” Ned sighs, plopping down on one of the chairs next to Peter. Peter looks up at his friend and nods. “Did I miss anything?”

“I mean, Flash harassing y/n, the girl who works here? Other then that, I guess not.”

“She’s the daughter of the owners of the hotel, right?”

“Yeah,” Peter nods. “The pretty one.”

Although Peter says this in a rather hushes tone, Ned hears it and grins. “Do you like her?”

“What?” Peter is flustered and unsure of what to say. Ned shakes his head and sighs.

“It’s okay, Peter. It’s been forever since Liz, so I think it was only a matter of time before you liked someone else.”

Before Peter could say anything else, Betty and MJ join the boys and the group begins browsing the menu, which offered different things everyday. It helped keep a variation on the foods that the hotel guests could eat, which was great. When y/n makes her way over to take their order, Ned eyes Peter teasingly, which only makes him blush even more. Y/N doesn’t really understand what is going on but doesn’t ask. Instead, she picks up their menus and tells them that someone will bring up their drinks and food in a minute.

As planned, Peter waits for y/n after everyone is done with dinner. Most of his classmates had gone down to the game room to play pool and whatnot, while others were either in their room or in the courtyard. Y/N comes out of the kitchen , but today she is not holding her copy of Call Me By Your Name.

“Scusate per il ritardo/Sorry for the delay.”

“Non ti preoccupare, non mi dispiace/Do not worry, I don’t mind.”

Y/N smiles at him, the corners of her eyes wrinkling. She offers her hand, which Peter takes shyly.

“We can go on a walk today? A break from reading.” y/n suggests.

Peter agrees, and the two exit the hotel and walk down the worn sidewalk. The sun has long since gone down, and in its place was a pale, full moon. Crickets chirped from somewhere nearby, and the leaves rustled gently, dancing with the wind. Peter wasn’t necessarily sure where y/n was taking him, but he didn’t mind. As long as he was with her, he felt at ease, and he hoped she felt the same way. They end up at the park that Peter had been at earlier that day, and the two walk towards the sandy shore of the lake. Warm water rippled from the center of the lake towards the edge, causing the tiniest waves. The moon’s reflection lit up the area, lit up y/n’s face even, as he turned to look at her.

She wore a thoughtful look on her face. Her loose hair tumbled down her shoulders, and Peter gave into his urge of tucking some behind her ear. Y/N smiled as she turned to look at him.

“Flash ti ha ferito/Did Flash hurt you?” Peter asks quietly.

“No. Ma parliamo di qualcos'altro/No, but let’s talk about something else, please?”

“Okay.”

The couple sits down close to each other and look out at the water, silent for a moment before y/n talks. She asks about Peter’s life in New York, what the states are like and his family and friends. As the two talk, y/n rests her head on his shoulders, curling up closer to the boy. After a moment of hesitation, Peter puts an arm around her, which she holds with her own.

It had not been the best day, not for y/n, but being here with a boy like Peter, near calming waters talking about each other, she hoped it would mean it would all be okay. At least for tonight. She was glad Peter didn’t push her to talk about things she didn’t want to. That he cared about her feelings, and above all, he respected her. Peter was what she wanted in a boy.

by Lansfics7

Infinity War! Obviously all rights go to Marvel and any character, lines, and plot points that are in the movie I obviously don’t own. I just love to write them out and add a bit of stuff of my own when the ‘camera’ is on someone else during the movie! Since I changed up the previous events a bit, some things will also change.
I suggest reading I Got You First (since this is the second book) if you haven’t already.
Enjoy! And I already apologize profusely for the ending because you all know what happens. :(

summary: I just noticed how MJ and Peter’s daughters both are named after the most supportive / influential women in their lives: Aunt...
body:
I just noticed how MJ and Peter’s daughters both are named after the most supportive / influential women in their lives: Aunt Anna (Annie) and Aunt May (Mayday).

And coincidentally, they are the ones that led to Peter and MJ meeting and eventually fall in love.

Wow, just…My OTP just never ceases to amaze me.

title: Hidden Books and Library Dust
body:
So me and @underoos-shield​ did a thing… we both had the prompt of library and pretty much had free reign with the rest of it. So thanks so much bub; I really really enjoyed this!! (There’s more under the cut!!)

Peter Parker x Reader with the prompt “library”

Word Count: 926

Psst.

Y/N blinked, frowning. She could’ve sworn she her someone try to get her attention the same way her mom does someti-

PSst.

Okay, someone was  definitely trying to signal her. She looked around from where she sat at a table near the back of the library, books and papers spread out around her. Craning her neck, the girl looked around, trying to find the person who so desperately wanted her attention.

And then she saw him.

He waved from a table near the nonfiction books. Chair balanced  on two legs, leaning up against a bookshelf, an impish grin on his face, messy curls, and a pencil tucked behind his ear. He motioned for her to come over. Smiling slightly, she motioned to her book, then pointed at her obnoxiously long essay she had to write. Rolling his eyes playfully, he got up and made his way over to the table where Y/N was sitting. “Geez, Y/N, you really are deaf, aren’t you?” the boy said, flopping down on a chair next to her.

“I’m not deaf, Peter!” Y/N whispered indignantly. “Plus, I’m trying to finish this essay so I don’t have all hell break loose on me next Tuesday.”

“Yeah, that’s probably a good idea. But I want to show you something.”

“Can it wait?”

“Nope.”

“C'mon Peter, I really need to get this done. Maybe after.”

“Please?” Peter asked, pouting. “Promise I’ll leave you alone then.”

“Ugh. Fine,” Y/N stood up, tucking a bookmark into her textbook and shutting it. “This better be good.”

“It is.” Peter smiled, grabbing her hand and tugging her along.

Slightly surprised, Y/N let herself be led to… wherever they were going. They passed tables of people: reading, writing, sleeping. Y/N followed Peter through stacks of books, shelves with cookbooks and mysteries, picture books and science fiction, how-to manuals and physics novels. They finally stopped in a corner full of outdated dictionaries.

“Peter, what is going on?” Y/N asked suspiciously, swiping her finger across the shelf and picking up a trail of dust. “This corner looks like it hasn’t been touched in ages!”

“Just be quiet, and follow me. We’re not there yet.” He led her around the corner into a harshly illuminated hallway, a stark contrast from the dusty lighting they had just been in.

The hallway was relatively short, white doors lining the monotonous white walls. It didn’t seem calm and inviting like the rest of the library, but boring and lifeless. Peter walked towards a door near the end of the hallway, a bright yellow DO NOT ENTER- UNDER CONSTRUCTION sign. “Peter, are you sure this is where you want to be-”

“Yeah, I’m sure. Now come on. They’ve stopped construction so no one is up here anymore.”

Y/N followed Peter, who pushed open the door to reveal a long flight of stairs. At the top, a plain door stood inconspicuously. He pushed it open, and they stepped out onto the roof. In one corner stood a small garden full of plants in all shapes and sizes, with a bench situated in the foliage. In another there stood a weather-beaten terrace, obviously not used in many years. The third corner was closed in, much like a porch. Peter headed toward that corner. “Wow.” Y/N looked around, surprise. “Why do they have all of this on the roof of a library?”

“I’m not quite sure.” Peter answered, opening the porch door and walking inside. “I think they were planning on making a rooftop garden with books for when the weather was nice like this, but they never finished it. Now I’m the only one who ever comes up here, so I take the books that I’m reading and put them up here. That way, no one can take them.” He ran his thumb along the shelf of books, selecting a rather thick volume and pulling it out. “This is one of my favourites.”

“Les Misérables. I love this one.” Y/N smiled as she lifted the book from Peter’s hands. She looked up at him, eyes sparkling. “How long have you known about this place?”

“About a month. It really got more enjoyable once the weather got warmer. Here, follow me.” Peter opened up a cabinet in the corner, grabbing a blanket and stuffing it under his arm. They walked out of the covered room into the warm early summer evening. The sun was shooting up it’s last rays as it was swallowed in a sea of pinks and yellows. The air was heavy with the sunset, the world preparing to sleep. Peter spread the blanket out on the floor, sitting down and patting the ground next to him. Y/N situated herself next to him, looking up at the sky.

“It’s so beautiful up here. You’re really lucky to have found this place,” she said, looking at the boy next to her.

“And I’m even luckier to share it with someone even more beautiful.” He smiled, seeing the girl next to him blush. He sighed, gazing up at the picturesque sky above them.

Y/N grinned, then pressed a kiss to Peter’s cheek. He started, then looked down at Y/N playfully. “You can do it again, if you’d like.”

She laughed, before pushing his curls to one side and brushing her lips against his. 

They were surrounded by the fading light, beauty encircling their corner of the world. The Sun’s last tendrils bade the world goodnight, fireflies blinking to life around them.

And if they stayed there past midnight to count stars? They were the only ones to know.

He waved from a table near the nonfiction books. Chair balanced  on two legs, leaning up against a bookshelf, an impish grin on his face, messy curls, and a pencil tucked behind his ear. He motioned for her to come over. Smiling slightly, she motioned to her book, then pointed at her obnoxiously long essay she had to write. Rolling his eyes playfully, he got up and made his way over to the table where Y/N was sitting. “Geez, Y/N, you really are deaf, aren’t you?” the boy said, flopping down on a chair next to her.

“I’m not deaf, Peter!” Y/N whispered indignantly. “Plus, I’m trying to finish this essay so I don’t have all hell break loose on me next Tuesday.”
